--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "texanworker" <texanworker@a...> wrote:
> I installed Redhat 9, junit 3.8.1, and two JDK's -- 1.4.1 versions 01
> and 02.
> 
> Regardless of how I set classpath, the TestRunner will run and
> find no classes.  
> 
> It is puzzling that junit.jar can be found in order to run the
> TestRunner class, but it cannot find the junit.samples.AllTests
> class.
> 

Everyone, I'm sorry for wasting bandwidth.  The problem was one
of the stupid errors that's incredibly obvious after you see it.
The search path described in the documentation mentions junit.jar.
So, of course, I initially had a path that specified junit.jar
without also listing the home directory.  I erroneously thought
that the test classes would be found automatically, but of course
the search must see
$JUNIT_HOME:$JUNIT_HOME/junit.jar
in order to find *both* TestRunner and the test classes.

This is so obvious in hindsight I feel terribly silly.

Sorry for having wasted the time and bandwidth.  I'll try to
ask less trivial questions in the future.
